content.description:
You might pitch off this one on a hot day.

Sustained stemming and right foot high stepping up steep oatmeal past 8 decent bolts, stays stimulating until just above the last bolt traverse sorta right on easy terrain to Chute to Kill's anchor.
content.protection: 8 bolts and bolted belay above Chute to Kill.  Rappel from Lead Us No Into Temptation's anchor 70 meter rope works best.
content.location: Starts off the right side of the main ledge / featured block on the west face of North Astro Dome, just right of the start of two bolted routes - Lead Us and Godsend.  The first bolt is just above this ledge.

content.description: This long bolted slab is on the sunny south face of the North Astrodome, on the left side of the face.
content.location: On the far left side of the So. face of the N. Astrodome.

climbs.name: Lead Us Not Into Temptation
climbs.fa: Herb Laeger, Dennis Knuckles and Jan McCollum, January 1978

content.description:
Near the left margin of the wall scramble to a ledge at the base of the route. Steep smears and edges past six bolts lead past to a bolted anchor/rap.

A nice climb in an out of the way location that is often overlooked because of a lengthy, rather involved approach.
Climb the corner via jams and liebacks.
content.location: This route climbs a prominent left-facing corner at the right end of the face.

content.description: Start up a low angled slab past a couple bolts and then climb the steeper face.  A full 34.5 meter rap off the top anchors.
content.location: Right of Lead Us Not Into Temptation

content.description: If you're back here and having fun on the other routes, give this one a try too. It certainly does have an issue of being run-out but the start is well protected as well as the higher crux. Rock quality is fair and for the length of the route, a worthwhile adventure. Crazy old bolts on this one!
content.protection: 4 old bolts and a shared anchor atop Chute to Kill.

content.description:
This route will test your faith in the J-Tree stone! Very delicate thin edging starts the route off with a crux section between the 3rd and 5th bolts. The start could be considered the 10c section depending on height. A fun route to top-rope as well after climbing

Lead Us Not Into Temptation

(5.9). The best decent is to rap off the Lead Us Not Into Temptation anchors.  Enjoy!
content.protection: 6 Bolts to a 2 bolt anchor (with no rap rings).
